StyleSheet Class

In this Article

Organizes styles that will be applied to other controls. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.StyleSheetDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.Editor(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.StyleSheetComponentEditor), typeof(System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.WebControlToolboxItem))]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder(typeof(System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheetControlBuilder))]
[System.Web.UI.ToolboxData("<{0}:StyleSheet runat="server"></{0}:StyleSheet>")]
public class StyleSheet : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • Control
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl
  • StyleSheet

Remarks

A StyleSheet control can contain any number of style objects, or more specialized style objects that inherit from the Style class. These should have unique name properties. You can then refer to other controls on the same page by their Name property. This class has no visual representation.

A page can also use an external style sheet, and several pages can share the same external style sheet. For more information about styles, refer to the <style> element and the Styles topic.

Note

The StyleSheet control ignores its own style attributes; setting a style attribute on the StyleSheet itself has no effect on the styles contained as children within the StyleSheet control.

Constructors summary

StyleSheet()

Initializes a new instance of the StyleSheet class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

Alignment

Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BackColor

Gets or sets the background color for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
BreakAfter

Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Default

Returns the default style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
EnableViewState

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server control persists its view state, and the view state of any child controls it contains, to the requesting client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Font

Returns a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ForeColor

Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Item(String)

Gets or sets a Style object in the style sheet, by name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
ReferencePath

Gets or sets a reference to a user control (.ascx file). The default value is null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
StyleReference

Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Styles

Returns the collection of styles in a style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Visible

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Wrapping

Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

AddParsedSubObject(Object)

Notifies the server control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Clear()

Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
LoadViewState(Object)

Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
Remove(String)

Removes the specified style from the style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SaveViewState()

Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
TrackViewState()

Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's StateBag object. This object is accessible through the stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • StyleSheet()

    Initializes a new instance of the StyleSheet class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public StyleSheet ();

Properties

  • Alignment

    Gets or sets the specified alignment for the style. The default value is Alignment. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Alignment Alignment { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Alignment

      An enumerated value specifying the alignment for the style.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The Alignment property was accessed at run time.

      -or-

      An attempt was made to set the property.

    Remarks

    For possible values, see Alignment.

  • BackColor

    Gets or sets the background color for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override System.Drawing.Color BackColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The specified background color for the style.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The BackColor property was accessed at run time.

      -or-

      An attempt was made to set the property.

    Remarks

    Unlike the other properties, the BackColor property is not inherited from its parent. For example, if you set the BackColor property to cyan on a parent control, a child control will not inherit the background color of cyan. You must explicitly set the child control's BackColor property to cyan, or you must set the BackColor property of the parent control and apply the style sheet to the child control. This is consistent with the behavior of cascading style sheets.

  • BreakAfter

    Gets or sets a property that determines whether an additional trailing break is rendered after the control. This break causes subsequent content to start on the next line. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override bool BreakAfter { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if an additional trailing break is rendered after the control; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The BreakAfter property was accessed at run time.

      -or-

      An attempt was made to set the property.

  • Default

    Returns the default style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public static System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet Default { get; }

    Property Value

    • StyleSheet

      The default style sheet.

    Remarks

    The default style sheet supports a number of styles.

  • EnableViewState

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server control persists its view state, and the view state of any child controls it contains, to the requesting client. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override bool EnableViewState { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the server control maintains its view state; otherwise false. The default is true.

  • Font

    Returns a FontInfo object that contains font information about the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.FontInfo Font { get; }

    Property Value

    • FontInfo

      The FontInfo that contains the font information about the control.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The Font property was accessed at run time,

  • ForeColor

    Gets or sets the specified foreground color for the style. Typically, this property sets the color for the text. The default value is Empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override System.Drawing.Color ForeColor { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Color

      The foreground Color of the control.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The ForeColor property was accessed at run time.

      -or-

      An attempt was made to set the property.

    Remarks

    You can use the ForeColor property to display text in a different color. For more information, see ForeColor.

  • Item(String)

    Gets or sets a Style object in the style sheet, by name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style this[string name] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The key used to identify the style.

    Property Value

    • Style

      The Style object in the style sheet with the specified name.

  • ReferencePath

    Gets or sets a reference to a user control (.ascx file). The default value is null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public string ReferencePath { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A reference to a user control (.ascx file).

    Remarks

    The style sheet on the page inherits the styles in a style sheet defined at the root level of the referenced user control. For example, if the style sheet on the user control has a property named Style1, the page can access Style1 as if it were in the style sheet on the page.

  • StyleReference

    Gets or sets a reference to the style properties for a control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override string StyleReference { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A reference to the style properties for a control.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      The StyleReference property was accessed at run time.

      -or-

      An attempt was made to set the property.

    Remarks

    The value of the StyleReference property must be the Name property of a Style object.

  • Styles

    Returns the collection of styles in a style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public System.Collections.ICollection Styles { get; }

    Property Value

    • ICollection

      The collection of styles in a style sheet.

  • Visible

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a server control is rendered as UI on the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override bool Visible { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the control is visible on the page; otherwise false.

  • Wrapping

    Gets or sets the specified wrapping mode for the style. The default value is Wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public override System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping Wrapping { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Wrapping

      An enumerated value that specifies the wrapping mode for the style.

      Exception type
      		 Condition
      Exception The Wrapping property was accessed at run time.
      -or-
      An attempt was made to set the property.

    Remarks

    For more information, see Wrapping.

Methods

  • AddParsedSubObject(Object)

    Notifies the server control that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void AddParsedSubObject (object o);

    Parameters

    • o
      Object

      An object that represents the parsed element.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      the object to be added does not have a Name attribute.

  • Clear()

    Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    This method is not available in the read-only IObjectListFieldCollection interface.

    You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a StyleSheet collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection, it clears all the choices in the collection.

    Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

  • LoadViewState(Object)

    Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void LoadViewState (object savedState);

    Parameters

    • savedState
      Object

      An Object that represents the control state to be restored.

  • Remove(String)

    Removes the specified style from the style sheet. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public void Remove (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the style to remove.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The specified style does not exist.

  • SaveViewState()

    Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override object SaveViewState ();

    Returns

    • Object

      Returns the server control's current view state. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns null.

  • TrackViewState()

    Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's StateBag object. This object is accessible through the stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void TrackViewState ();
